page.title: 01WARE, HERTFORD AND BENGEO
page.content: Ware and Hertford are small, adjoining {market towns,}surrounded by attractive farmland.Bengeo forms part of Hertford but is separated by Hartham Park.There are pleasant walks along three{rivers} or a{canal}and through{woods}or{parks. The area is a rich source of{sand and {gravel}which is extracted before the land is returned to{agriculture. Although the{industry}is not dominant, there is low unemployment. Many people work out of the area. Some commute to London or other large towns. The built-up areas are quiet, peaceful communities.New{houses}are being built on suitable sites, though people are keen to preserve the{Green Belt.}There are no cinemas or large sports centres but there are several{clubs}to join. It is a good place to live because of the{countryside and fresh air,}and you are never far from a large town.
